New Records: The White Sox remain tied with the 1962 New York Mets for the modern major league record of 120 losses in a season
The White Sox passed the record of 106 losses prior to this year
Key Match Events: The Angels took a 1-0 lead in the seventh
The White Sox rallied in the eighth to tie the game at 2-2
Jonathan Cannon pitched three-hit ball over six scoreless innings for Chicago
Pre-Game Insights: The White Sox have five games left — two more against the Angels and three at Detroit — to set a record no team wants
Post-Match Reflections: Andrew Benintendi said, "It’s been a long season. I think that people here tonight were maybe trying to see history. But they’re going to have to wait one more day. Maybe."
Miscellaneous Highlights: Fans voiced their displeasure with White Sox chairman Jerry Reinsdorf by chanting “Sell the team!” throughout the game
Others: The Angels moved within one loss of the franchise record held by the 1968 and 1980 teams
